channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: The Step-by-Step Guide to Making your Friends Green with Envy
item.description: How many times have you been at a party and had to grin and bear it while your mates brag about their cool jobs? Robertâ€™s working from Antigua for the week, and Susanâ€™s taking yet another vacationâ€”how many days off can one woman have? Never fearâ€”weâ€™ve got the Step-by-Step Guide to Making your Friends Green with Envy.

item.title: Pittsburgh is for Animal Lovers
item.description: Pittsburgh, PA is known for steel, the Pittsburgh Penguins, and . . . animal lovers? Thatâ€™s rightâ€”if your heart goes double-time for grumpy cats and pooches in precarious positions, then this role might be the one for you!

item.title: Seeking Abominable Snowman (or Snowwoman) for Junior Perl Developer Role!
item.description: What would you say if I told you there was a ski-in/ski-out job waiting for you in Switzerland? Okay, so the ski-in/ski-out part might be as difficult to find as a yeti in a blizzard, but if youâ€™re a junior developer who is a fan of the great outdoors and youâ€™ve got excellent English skills, then we have the role for you!

item.title: A little bird told me this might be the job for you! Perl Developer in Canary Wharf
item.description: Pop quiz: Where can you go to enjoy an Indian curry, take in a concert, search out the perfect whiskey sour AND get paid? Weâ€™ll give you a hint: itâ€™s where our clientâ€™s office is located, and itâ€™s in one of the most accessible areas in London. One more hint? A little bird told me this might be the job for one dynamic Perl programmer . . .

item.title: Enjoy Modern Perl with a properly Agile team in Manchester; mid-Level Perl Developer
item.description: Tired of seeing endless London-based Perl jobs? Want to program Modern Perl in the Glorious North instead, where the people are friendly, the tea tastes right? if youâ€™d like to be programming your favourite programming language outside of London, in a Modern way and in a collaborative environment, get in touch, and weâ€™ll help you get the application started.

item.title: 2019.44 Comma and Cro

item.title: #433 - Tabs or spaces, finally we have the answer!
item.description:
Hi there,

yesterday I went over the list of rss and atom feeds I used to monitor for Perl-related articles and disabled the ones that did not have a post for more than 2 years or where the site behind them was gone.

This cleaning was long overdue, but doing it now all of them together made me sad. So many clever and nice people we used to have in the Perl community who used to write posts. And so few keep writing.

Where are the others? Are they still using Perl at work? At least as a hobby?

But don't despair, next week Mohammad Anwar is the editor and he is very enthusiastic :)

Enjoy your week!
